intro: Melampyrum pratense var. flagrans, commonly known as the fiery glowcup, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Oxyales order and belongs to the family Oxyaceae, now considered part of the Poaceae (grass family). The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of bright orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and the plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It is often found in shaded areas but can tolerate a range of light conditions.
